title: Mercantile Ports & Logistics Shares Rise After Tata Contract Win
text:
By Adria Calatayud

Shares in Mercantile Ports & Logistics Ltd. (MPL.LN) rose in early trade Monday after the company said it has won a contract with a joint venture between Tata Group and Daewoo Engineering & Construction Co. (047040.SE).

The contract is expected to generate revenue of more than 5.5 million pounds ($6.8 million) over a 40-month period starting April 2020, the U.K. port and logistics company said. The deal can be extended for an additional 18 months, Mercantile said.

Mercantile, which is developing a port and logistics facility in Navi Mumbai, India, said the Daewoo-Tata JV will use its Karanja Terminal as its port, logistics and engineering base to execute its work streams for the construction of India's longest sea bridge, the Mumbai Trans Harbour Link.

Mercantile shares at 0755 GMT were up 12% at 1.60 pence.
